page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
GUITING/SUDELEY
This area lies on the edge of the Cotswolds over looking Winchcombe. It is designated as an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is a rich farming area with cereals, sheep, cattle and a large area of woodland. There are environmental constraints on development. The western part lies in Tewkesbury Borough Council Administrative Area and slopes down from 800ft above sea level to 400ft. This is part of Sudeley. The eastern half is in the North Cotswold Administrative Area and lies on the Cotswold Plateau which is cut into by deep valleys. It includes Guiting Wood. This part is Administered from Moreton-on-the-Marsh.
